title: Rahul Mamkootathil rape case: Husband of accuser lodges complaint against Palakkad MLA

title: Indore water contamination crisis: Trust on municipal tap supply dries up; residents pay for water
content: The water contamination tragedy in Indore, also the country's cleanest city for almost a decade, has left people shunning municipal tap supply and scurrying for bottled water, putting a financial strain on those with limited means

title: NOC not mandatory to open the Mahakalipadpu RuB as claimed by Mangaluru Smart City, says Railways

content: The exhibition marks a historic moment with the reunification of the Piprahwa gem relics of Lord Buddha, repatriated after 127 years

content: The Chief Minister has instructed the Health Department to implement the scheme, which comes under the 'Saat Nischay' initiative of the Nitish Kumar Government, on a priority basis

title: RSS no paramilitary organisation; can’t be understood by looking at BJP, says Mohan Bhagwat
content: RSS works to unite society and imbue it with the necessary qualities and virtues to ensure that India does not fall into the clutches of a foreign power again, Mohan Bhagwat said

title: Sri Lankan Navy arrests nine fishermen from Mayiladuthurai
content: The arrest comes a day after the Sri Lankan Navy apprehended 11 fishermen from the Karaikal region on charges of crossing the IMBL

title: 18 people arrested in Assam's Karbi Anglong for murdering couple over witchcraft suspicion

title: Leaders pay tribute to freedom fighters Rani Velu Nachiyar, Veerapandiya Kattabomman
content: In a post on X, Vice President of India C.P. Radhakrishnan described Rani Velu Nachiyar as an enduring icon of women’s strength and leadership and one of India’s earliest woman freedom fighters

title: NGO bagged election survey project through competitive bidding: Karnataka govt
content: The survey was commissioned by Karnataka’s Chief Electoral Office (CEO) through KMEA, and GRAAM, Mysuru-based NGO, bagged the project through a bidding process, having scored a high technical score by a committee of experts constituted by KMEA, said sources

title: 2026 jallikattu season kicks off at Thatchankurichi in Pudukottai
content: The event was inaugurated by Minister for Natural Resources S. Regupathy and Minister for Backward Classes Welfare Siva V. Meyyanathan in the presence of District Collector M. Aruna, who administered the oath to the tamers

title: Kerala MLA and former Minister Antony Raju found guilty in evidence tampering case
content: Verdict comes 19 years after chargesheet was filed against the Thiruvananthapuram MLA. He was accused of tampering with an Australian’s underwear, which was seized as material evidence in a 1990 drug case

title: Arvind Kashyap: Flying drones to shooting magnum opuses
content: Cinematographer Arvind Kashyap, who worked in the pan-India blockbuster ‘Kantara: Chapter 1’, directed by Rishab Shetty, talks to The Hindu.

title: UGC takes cognizance of Dharamshala student's death, fact-finding panel formed, regulator adds 'culprits will not be spared'
content: "A police inquiry is underway, and UGC has constituted a Fact-Finding Committee to examine the incident. UGC assures that culprits will not be spared and that stringent action will follow," says official

title: ‘Double-engine government’ needed for Kerala’s development, says Union Minister Suresh Gopi
content: Thrissur MP says ‘for the development of Kerala, there should either be a BJP government or a situation where BJP can influence governance’

title: PM Modi hails Savitribai Phule on her birth anniversary
content: Savitribai Phule was born in 1831 in Maharashtra and considered by many as India’s first woman teacher due to her pioneering work for educating women — especially from deprived groups — when it was considered a taboo

content: Officials said the programme is designed not only to improve students' general knowledge and social awareness but also to prepare them better for competitive examinations

title: Maharashtra’s first woman DGP Rashmi Shukla retires

title: Loud Explosions In Venezuela After Trump Warns Of Ground Strikes
content: Loud explosions, accompanied by sounds resembling aircraft flyovers, were heard in Caracas around 2:00 am (0600 GMT) Saturday, an AFP journalist reported.

title: Venezuela President Maduro, Wife Captured, Flown Out Of Country: Trump
content: Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro and his wife have been captured and "flown out of the country", US President Donald Trump said as he confirmed airstrikes on the Venezuelan capital, Caracas.

title: PM Modi Inaugurates Grand Exhibition Of Buddha Relics In Delhi
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi inaugurated the Grand International Exposition of Sacred Piprahwa Relics, titled "The Light & the Lotus: Relics of the Awakened One," at the Rai Pithora Cultural Complex in New Delhi on Saturday.

title: US Teen Told New Year's Attack Plot To Undercover Agent Posing As ISIS Member
content: Sturdivant was visiting ISIS websites, posting related content on TikTok, and communicating online with individuals he believed were ISIS members.

title: Venezuela Strikes Updates: Trump Confirms "Large-Scale Strikes" On Caracas
content: Multiple explosions heard in Venezuela LIVE Updates: The United States on Sunday confirmed that it conducted strikes inside Venezuela moments after several explosions were heard in the capital Caracas and other parts of the country.

title: Over 130 Arrested In Visa, Passport Fraud Crackdown In India Last Year
content: The Delhi Police arrested over 130 individuals in 2025, including travel agents and facilitators, as part of its crackdown on visa and passport fraud.

title: Congress Announces' MNREGA Bachao Abhiyan' From January 8 To Oppose G RAM G
content: The Congress on Saturday announced a nationwide agitation against the G-RAMG Act from January 8, alleging that it "silently kills" the MNREGA and undermines the legal right to work guaranteed to rural citizens.

title: Allies To Rivals: Why Saudi Arabia And UAE Are Now Clashing In Yemen
content: A decade after fighting side by side in Yemen, Saudi Arabia and the United Arab Emirates, once the closest of Gulf allies, are now locked in an unusually public confrontation. Once close allies, the two countries are now backing rival groups in Yemen

title: "Antisemitic Gasoline On Open Fire": Israel Slams Zohran Mamdani Over Revoked Orders
content: The Israeli Foreign Ministry has slammed New York City (NYC) Mayor Zohran Mamdani after he revoked Israel-related executive orders signed by his predecessor Eric Adams.

title: Blasts, Ambushes, Massacres: Top Maoist Barse Deva's Trail Over 20 Years
content: A 48-year-old senior CPI (Maoist) commander Barse Deva laid down his arms in Hyderabad, marking the end of one of the bloodiest chapters of Left Wing Extremism in central India.

title: "Full Body Functionality Is Possible": Elon Musk On Neuralink Breakthrough
content: Billionaire Elon Musk on Saturday said that his brain-computer interface company Neuralink can possibly restore full body functionality.

title: Hindu Man Khokon Das Dies After Being Beaten, Set On Fire In Bangladesh
content: Khokon Chandra Das, the Hindu man in Bangladesh who was attacked with sharp weapons and set afire, died today after battling for life in a Dhaka hospital, his family said.

title: Videos Show Buildings On Fire, Huge Smoke After Blasts In Venezuela
content: Donald Trump, who has deployed a navy task force to the Caribbean, has for weeks threatened ground strikes on drug cartels in the region.

title: The Politics Behind IPL Controversy Over Bangladeshi Player In KKR

title: BJP Alleges Rs 100 Crore Flood Relief Scam In Bengal, Cites CAG Report
content: The West Bengal Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) on Friday launched a sharp attack on the All India Trinamool Congress (TMC), citing a 700-page report by the Comptroller and Auditor General (CAG) submitted to the Calcutta High Court.

title: After UP, Rajasthan Mandates Newspaper Reading In Government Schools
content: The Rajasthan government has made daily newspaper reading compulsory in all government schools in an effort to promote reading habits, improve vocabulary and enhance general awareness among students.

title: Delhi Man Objects To Loud Music On New Year, Stabbed By Teens
content: New Year's evening left a trail of blood in its wake in Delhi with three stabbings and a partially burnt body staining the start of 2026.

title: Rashmi Shukla, Maharashtra's 1st Woman Top Cop, Retires
content: Rashmi Shukla, Maharashtra's first woman Director General of Police (DGP), retired on Saturday, having completed 37 and a half years in the Indian Police Service.

title: Election Commission Details 91.46 Lakh Voter Discrepancy Cases In West Bengal
content: The Election Commission of India (ECI) has furnished a breakup of the 91.46 lakh "logical discrepancy" cases identified in the course of "progeny-mapping" during the ongoing Special Intensive Revision (SIR) in West Bengal.

title: Delhi records low of 8.1 degrees Celsius, air quality ‘poor’
content: Delhi's Air Quality Index (AQI) stood at 240, in the "poor" category, Central Pollution Control Board (CPCB) data showed

title: Man beaten up over Bangladeshi suspicion in Bihar's Madhubani; attempt to murder case filed

title: The Aravalli hills are shaken with the sound of machinery
content: A 2-billion-year-old range has been battered and bruised by mining, waste dumping, and encroachment, say environmentalists and those who live in its shadow. The Supreme Court order accepting the changed definition of the Aravalli hills caused further worry, though it has since been stayed. Ishita Mishra reports on the people living in the foothills, who believe that decisions about the Aravallis should involve and benefit communities

title: Signature campaign in Kolkata to protect tamarind tree planted by revolutionary 70 years ago

title: India’s deep dive into the frozen frontier

title: Historic bell set to ring again at 172-year-old church in Secunderabad

content: Former Ole Miss starting quarterback Austin Simmons is expected to enter the transfer portal, sources told ESPN. He is likely headed to Missouri, sources told ESPN's Pete Thamel.

content: Mika Zibanejad had a hat trick, Artemi Panarin scored twice and the Rangers beat the Panthers 5-1 on Friday night in the Winter Classic -- the first outdoor game played in Florida.

content: Finland stunned the two-time defending champion United States 4-3 on Friday night in the world junior hockey quarterfinals.

content: Marcel Reed announced Friday that he will return to Texas A&M for the 2026 season after leading the Aggies to their first CFP appearance.

title: Sources: Sorsby, top portal QB, to visit TTU, LSU
content: Quarterback Brendan Sorsby, the top player in the transfer portal, will visit Texas Tech and LSU, sources told ESPN. Sorsby combined for 36 touchdowns this season for Cincinnati.

content: T.J. Watt said he is looking forward to his return from a punctured lung and that he hasn't discussing playing on a snap count against the Ravens.

content: Patriots wide receiver Stefon Diggs and defensive tackle Christian Barmore both declined to comment on the pending charges against each player in separate assault cases.

content: e-Paper The View From India Looking at World Affairs from the Indian perspective . first day first show news and reviews from the world of cinema and streaming . the weekly newsletter from science writers takes the jargon out of science and puts the fun in!

title: 'Maduro, wife captured': Trump says Venezuela leader 'flown out of country'; what he said
content: Former US President Donald Trump announced a "large scale strike" against Venezuela, claiming President Nicolás Maduro and his wife have been captured. This follows a series of explosions in Caracas, with low-flying aircraft and power outages reported. The FAA banned US commercial flights in Venezuelan airspace due to "ongoing military activity."

title: 'Criminal military aggression': Venezuela govt after US attack—what we know
content: Venezuela accuses the US of attacking civilian and military sites, prompting President Maduro to declare a state of emergency and call for mass mobilization. US officials confirmed President Trump ordered strikes on Venezuelan military facilities, escalating a campaign against the Maduro government amid a regional military buildup and recent seizures of oil tankers.

title: ‘Mindless politicising of sport’: Tharoor slams Mustafizur Rahman’s IPL exit
content: Sharing a video from Friday, Tharoor made his position clear on the issue. "Recalling my views on the subject, now that BCCI has deplorably pulled the plug on Mustafizur Rahman," he said. He then questioned the logic behind the move, adding: "And what if the Bangladeshi player in question had been Litton Das or Soumya Sarkar?"

title: China's DeepSeek returns: Proves cheaper AI works again; Silicon Valley shaken
content: Chinese AI firm DeepSeek unveiled a groundbreaking training method, "Manifold-Constrained Hyper-Connections," potentially slashing AI development costs. This innovation challenges the notion that advanced AI necessitates massive computing power, following their previous success with the R1 model. The breakthrough intensifies industry debates on scaling AI, with expectations high for DeepSeek's next model release.

title: Another Hindu dies in Bangladesh: Khokon Das succumbs to injuries 3 days after being set on fire
content: A Hindu businessman, Khokon Das, succumbed to his injuries after being attacked with sharp weapons and set ablaze in Bangladesh. Das was waylaid, beaten, and doused with petrol before being set on fire. This incident is part of a disturbing trend of violence targeting the Hindu community in Bangladesh.

title: Aadhaar in America? US billionaire backs universal digital identity; Musk pushes voter ID laws
content: Silicon Valley investor Vinod Khosla echoes Elon Musk's call for a universal US digital ID, inspired by India's Aadhaar. Khosla believes such a system, while opt-in, would enhance convenience and reduce fraud, similar to Aadhaar's success. This aligns with Musk's push for voter ID laws, prompted by concerns over election integrity ahead of the 2026 midterms.

title: Himachal student dies after 'sexual harassment', ragging; FIR against professor, 3 pupils
content: A Himachal Pradesh college professor and three students face charges of sexual harassment and ragging following the death of a 19-year-old student. The victim had accused them of mistreatment, which her father claims led to her depression and eventual death. Police are investigating the cause of death and verifying all allegations.

title: 'Leave your shoes behind': US tech startups' message to employees — here's why
content: American startups are adopting a 'no shoes' policy, with companies like Cursor and Replo encouraging employees to go barefoot. This trend, linked to the 'pajama economy' and Silicon Valley's '996' hustle culture, reflects a shift in work habits. However, the practice faces challenges in becoming mainstream due to societal perceptions of feet and age-related differences.

title: Tamil Nadu elections: Stalin launches DMK manifesto portal 2026
content: Tamil Nadu CM and DMK president MK Stalin launched the DMK Election Manifesto Portal 2026 in Chennai, inviting people from all sections of society to submit suggestions for the party’s assembly election manifesto. MP Kanimozhi Karunanidhi said the initiative aims to create a “people’s manifesto” and highlighted the DMK’s record of fulfilling its promises.

title: 'Ikkis' box office collection day 3 (Live)
content: Agastya Nanda's debut film 'Ikkis' is making waves at the box office. The war drama has surpassed the earnings of 'Tu Meri Main Tera Main Tera Tu Meri'. However, 'Ikkis' is facing stiff competition from 'Dhurandhar'. The film is based on the real-life story of Arun Khetrapal.

title: Cigarettes to get expensive from Feb 1! How much more will you pay? Check list
content: Get ready for pricier smokes! Starting February 1st, cigarette prices are set to climb due to a new excise duty hike and a 40% GST on tobacco. This move aims to align taxes with public health impacts and international standards, making cigarettes noticeably more expensive across various lengths.

title: Hardik Pandya goes berserk: Five sixes and a four in a single over to reach ton - Watch
content: Hardik Pandya delivered a remarkable performance in the Vijay Hazare Trophy. He scored a brilliant century for Baroda against Vidarbha. Pandya took control of the innings when his team was struggling. His powerful hitting included a remarkable over where he hit five sixes. Pandya's innings ensured Baroda posted a strong total. The Vidarbha bowlers found him difficult to contain.

title: No Mustafizur for KKR! IPL side confirms release of Bangladesh pacer
content: Kolkata Knight Riders have confirmed that Bangladeshi fast bowler Mustafizur Rahman has been released from their IPL squad following instructions from the BCCI. The decision came amid political and public controversy after his signing at the auction. KKR will be allowed to name a replacement player. Despite the turmoil off the pitch, Mustafizur continues to perform well in the Bangladesh Premier League.

title: 'Bihari girls available for marriage for Rs 25k': U'khand minister's husband sparks row
content: Uttarakhand minister Rekha Arya's husband sparked outrage with a remark suggesting Bihari girls are available for weddings at low prices. Political parties across Bihar condemned the statement, with the Bihar State Women Commission issuing a notice. Leaders demanded an apology and action against him.

title: Why Indian professionals are earning the most in Germany’s job market
content: Indian professionals working full-time in Germany earn the highest median salaries among all nationalities, not due to origin but occupation, a study by the German Economic Institute shows. Concentrated in high-paying STEM and research roles, Indians fill critical skill gaps in Germany’s ageing economy, underscoring how specialised expertise—not nationality—drives wages and innovation.

title: Tension in West Bengal: Mob attacks police for arresting TMC worker in Sandeshkhali
content: Six police personnel were injured in Sandeshkhali, West Bengal, after a mob attacked them during the arrest of TMC activist Musa Mollah. Villagers allegedly pelted stones and vandalized a police vehicle. Two local TMC leaders were also detained for allegedly instigating the violence.

title: Chhattisgarh encounter: Over 12 Maoists killed in Sukma, 2 in Bijapur
content: Security forces have eliminated 14 Maoists in separate encounters in Chhattisgarh's Sukma and Bijapur districts. The anti-insurgency operation, which began early Saturday, resulted in the recovery of bodies and a significant cache of weapons. Police sources indicated that commanders allegedly involved in the killing of Konta ASP Akash Rao Girepunje have been neutralized.

title: Amid IPL participation row, Mustafizur posts: 'Always grateful'
content: Bangladesh fast bowler Mustafizur Rahman has found himself at the centre of attention, both for his cricketing milestone and a growing controversy around his IPL participation. Amid the ongoing debate, Mustafizur took to social media to celebrate a personal achievement and his recent performance in the Bangladesh Premier League (BPL).

title: ‘They would kill me’: Student’s father claims bottle attack in Himachal 'sexual harassment' case
content: A 19-year-old student who alleged sexual harassment and ragging died in a Ludhiana hospital. An FIR has been filed against a professor and three female students at Govt College, Dharamshala, for their alleged involvement in the incident. Authorities are investigating the cause of death and verifying all allegations.

title: Drunk man climbs Tirupati temple tower, tries to vandalise Kalasams
content: A drunk man gained unauthorized access to Tirupati's Sri Govindaraja Swamy temple and attempted to damage its Gopuram, highlighting significant security vulnerabilities. The incident, which occurred late Friday night, led to the man's apprehension after a three-hour operation by police and fire services, prompting criticism over repeated security lapses.

title: Rupee in 2026: After 5% fall in 2025, where is the currency headed?
content: The Indian Rupee experienced a significant decline in 2025, falling nearly 5% against the US dollar. However, SBI predicts a turnaround in 2026, with the currency expected to strengthen due to favorable global conditions, potential capital inflows, and India's stable economic outlook.

title: NCERT to be granted deemed university status: Here is what that changes
content: NCERT, known for school textbooks, is poised to become a deemed-to-be-university by January's end. This move, supported by the Ministry of Education and awaiting UGC approval, will grant it academic autonomy to award degrees and conduct postgraduate research. The transformation aligns with the National Education Policy, enhancing its role in global academic collaboration and higher education.

title: 'No mistake of SRK': Maulana Sajid backs Shah Rukh amid Mustafizur Rahman row
content: Maulana Sajid Rashidi backs Shah Rukh Khan.  The All India Imam Association president stated the BCCI directive to remove Mustafizur Rahman from KKR should have come before the auction.  He believes the decision is politically motivated.  The BCCI asked KKR to release the Bangladeshi pacer for the 2026 IPL season.  A replacement will be permitted.

title: Who is Badse Deva alias Sukka? Most battle-hardened Maoist commander surrenders
content: A key People's Liberation Guerrilla Army battalion commander, Badse Deva alias Sukka, a close associate of Madvi Hidma, surrendered to Telangana police with several others. Deva, who carried significant rewards, was described as a battle-hardened commander linked to major Maoist attacks in central India.

title: 'Dhurandhar' BO collection day 30: Ranveer Singh starrer aims to cross Rs 750 cr mark
content: Ranveer Singh's 'Dhurandhar' continues its reign, nearing ₹750 crore on its 30th day. Meanwhile, Kartik Aaryan and Ananya Panday's 'Tu Meri Main Tera Main Tera Tu Meri' struggles, barely crossing ₹30 crore by its 10th day. The stark contrast highlights 'Dhurandhar's' immense box office dominance against newer releases.

title: 1 in 6 happy couples keep a backup partner: What it reveals about modern dating?
content: A recent survey found 16% of adults in committed relationships keep a "backup partner" in mind, with men more likely than women. This "what if" thinking often signals unmet needs for playfulness and passion within the current relationship. Experts suggest using these fantasies to reignite existing bonds through honesty and excitement.

title: Nagpur parents go to work, chain 12-yr-old 'habitual thief' at home
content: A 12-year-old boy in Nagpur was rescued after being chained and locked by his parents for hours daily over two months due to alleged cellphone theft. The school dropout, showing injuries from restraints and signs of trauma, has been moved to a government home for children. Police are investigating the incident.

title: Defaced, Indore’s ‘cleanest’ tag drowning? Officials point ‘dirty’ fingers at each other
content: Following a deadly diarrhea outbreak in Indore's Bhagirathpura area, elected representatives and officials are locked in a blame game over responsibility. The tragedy has exposed serious lapses within the BJP-led civic body, leading to the suspension of key officials, including the IMC commissioner, after the Chief Minister intervened.

title: Dhurandhar: No I&B ministry order to mute 'Baloch' in Ranveer Singh-starrer; what officials said
content: In a surprising turn of events, officials have now confirmed that the recent alterations to Aditya Dhar's film 'Dhurandhar', which include muted dialogues, were entirely the choice of the filmmakers. These modifications were implemented in accordance with the Cinematograph Act, rather than due to any government intervention. Read on to know more.

title: Caught on cam: Thief prays, hesitates for 15 seconds, then steals donation box at temple
content: A young man was captured on CCTV stealing a donation box from a temple in Lucknow, but not before displaying remarkable devotion. The thief was seen praying to Lord Hanuman, carefully moving offerings, and even walking backward to avoid disrespecting the deity. Police are analyzing the footage to identify the suspect, who may be a minor.

title: Maharashtra civic polls: 39 Mahayuti candidates win unopposed across 4 bodies
content: A significant number of unopposed victories, totaling 39 across four civic bodies near Mumbai, have sparked opposition allegations of bias and coercion. The State Election Commission will investigate these claims, particularly concerning withdrawals favouring BJP and Shinde Sena candidates. This early advantage for the ruling alliance has drawn criticism from various parties.

title: Bank holiday on Hazrat Ali: Where are banks closed on January 3? Check list
content: As 2026 begins, Indian banks will observe numerous national and state-specific holidays, impacting branch operations. Customers should consult the bank holiday calendar to avoid disruptions for in-branch transactions, though digital services remain accessible. Key closures include January 3rd for Hazrat Ali's birthday in Uttar Pradesh and January 26th for Republic Day nationwide.

title: New Year stabbings rock Delhi; tailor, teen, rickshaw driver killed in separate attacks
content: New Year's Eve turned tragic in Delhi with three separate stabbing incidents claiming as many lives. A tailor was killed after confronting noisy youths, an e-rickshaw driver died in a street brawl, and a 15-year-old boy was fatally stabbed. Investigations are underway, with some arrests made.

title: BCCI steps in: KKR asked to release Mustafizur Rahman
content: The BCCI has intervened in the political controversy surrounding Kolkata Knight Riders' signing of Mustafizur Rahman, asking the franchise to release the Bangladeshi pacer for the 2026 IPL season. This decision follows sharp political and religious objections to the player's inclusion, stemming from strained India-Bangladesh relations and concerns over violence in the neighboring country.

title: TN shocker: Man, live-in partner charred to death as group locks hut, sets it on fire
content: A 53-year-old man and his live-in partner were found charred to death in their hut in Tiruvannamalai district after it was allegedly set on fire by unidentified individuals. Police are investigating the suspicious deaths, considering potential involvement of the victims' estranged spouses. The couple had been living together for three years.

title: Dehradun police claim credible inputs from Nepal on Chakma’s murder key accused
content: Dehradun police are closing in on Yagya Awasthi, the final suspect in the murder of Tripura student Anjel Chakma.  Nepal's Central Investigation Bureau has provided crucial information about Awasthi's location.  He is believed to be hiding near the Indian border, having failed to reach his native place in Nepal.  Police teams are actively working to apprehend him.

title: Paulina Gretzky net worth 2025: wealth and career highlights
content: The daughter of a legendary hockey player, Wayne Gretzky, and a wife to a pro golf player, Dustin Johnson, Paulina Gretzky has established her own way in the industry of entertainment and social media. Having a net worth of five million dollars, she has been successful in business, modeling, and acting. It has also been reported that she will inherit a large portion of her father's fortune.

title: Now, Pakistan backs China's claim that it mediated during Op Sindoor
content: Pakistan has now endorsed China's claim of mediating the May 2025 India-Pakistan conflict, a move that raises eyebrows given India's stance.  Islamabad's foreign office spokesperson stated Chinese leaders were in contact with both nations, contributing to de-escalation. This assertion contrasts with India's position that the conflict pause followed a request from Pakistan's DGMO, not third-party intervention.

title: FCS national championship preview: Illinois State, Montana State starving for title
content: NDSU came within 37 seconds of a national title in 2014 . the Bobcats came up three points short of the title . they're the first team to win four road games in a single playoff run . it's their first title game since the 2014 heartbreath of FCS .

title: Olympic hockey roster grades for U.S., Canada, Finland, Sweden, plus snubs and surprises
content: the 2026 winter Olympic men's hockey tournament begins febr. 12 in Milan, Italy . the tournament promises to have some great games, battles for medals and of course the potential for another round in the USA vs. Canada rivalry . before the teams hit the ice, they needed to officially lock in their rosters .

title: Ravens vs. Steelers: Answering six questions ahead of Sunday's AFC North showdown
content: the Baltimore Ravens beat the Pittsburgh Steelers 13-6 on saturday night . the Ravens and the Steelers will battle for the AFC North crown on sunday . they will play in the final regular-season game of the 2025 season .

title: Claressa Shields, Gabriela Fundora, Amanda Serrano and more
content: women's boxing continued its rapid growth in 2025 . new faces have emerged, while several fighters have fallen out altogether . the year featured historic milestones, including multiple undisputed champions . a thrilling conclusion to the Katie Taylor-Amanda Serrano trilogy and Claressa Shields unifying all four heavyweight titles .

title: Bold MLB predictions for 2026: The World Series champion Orioles? A Skubal blockbuster?
content: we asked our experts to give their boldest predictions for what the new year will bring . a look into the crystal ball for the topics that will have us all talking in 2026 . the Baltimore Orioles finished last in the AL East in 2025, but their 75 wins were the most .

title: Olympic men's hockey central: Schedule, rosters, how to watch Milan-Cortina Games
content: the world's top professional hockey league is back for the Milan-Cortina Games . the opening ceremonies for the games are Feb. 6 . 10 other teams will be competing in the men's ice hockey tournament . a full game schedule, the latest news and broadcast information from the round-robin games .

title: College football transfer portal: Tracking who's on the move
content: Max Olson ranks Cincinnati's Brendan Sorsby as the top player in the transfer portal and predicts a recruitment battle between Texas Tech and LSU. (1:04) College football's transfer portal officially opened at midnight ET on Jan. 2. However, players have been announcing their intentions to transfer since the regular season ended. By midday on Day 1, more than 4,500 Division I college football players have entered the transfer portal. Players now have until Jan. 16 to enter their name to transfer. It doesn't mean they have to find their new schools by then -- or that they can't return to their previous schools. We are tracking the notable players entering the portal as well as those players who will re-sign with their current schools. Here's the latest news and updates on how the 2026 season could be transformed.

title: Daughter Kim's heir? Visit to mausoleum sparks buzz
content: the teenage daughter of north Korean leader Kim Jong Un made her first known visit to a sacred family mausoleum on new year's day . experts say the visit bolstered her status as her father's potential heir . the girl, reportedly named Kim Ju Ae and aged about 13 could be named an official at the ruling Workers' Party congress .

title: The psychology behind fraud: Why people fall prey despite knowing better
content: Representative AI image Red flags may still be visible, but the brain temporarily ignores them because emotional safety feels more urgent than accuracy. This is why scams often target people during vulnerable moments — late at night, after a loss, or during financial uncertainty. Emotional stress such as fear of loss, financial pressure, or loneliness activates the limbic system, particularly the amygdala, which prioritizes emotional survival responses over careful analysis.
